meanings.definition: The period of life just before adolescence.
meanings.sent1: During preadolescences, children start to experience changes in their bodies.
meanings.sent2: Her preadolescences were filled with curiosity and innocence.
meanings.sent3: In a world of preadolescences, everything seems new and exciting.
meanings.sent4: The preadolescences of spring bring forth the blossoming of youth.
meanings.sent5: The memories of preadolescences linger like a sweet fragrance.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being preadolescent.
meanings.sent1: His preadolescences was marked by awkwardness and growth spurts.
meanings.sent2: The preadolescences of the puppy made it endearing to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The preadolescences of the old computer showed in its slow processing speed.
meanings.sent4: She wore her preadolescences like a badge of honor, embracing her youthful spirit.
meanings.sent5: The preadolescences of the town reflected in the laughter of its young residents.
